Data: Starc to Mendis, 2 runs full and straight, neatly tucked off the pads backward of square
Starc to Mendis, no run a low full toss outside off, 141kph, square drives and finds cover
Starc to Mendis, no run well bowled! Hits a good length outside off, this one angles across the right hander and beats the drive
Starc to Mendis, no run a wider delivery, he flays at it away from the body and doesn't make contact
Starc to Mendis, 1 run short of a length at off stump, gets over the top of it and angles down to third man

Starc to Dickwella, OUT gone first ball! Gets a big leading edge into the off side, loops high towards point for a simple catch. Tried to close the face, was early on the stroke but it looked a poor option in the first place as the ball was full outside off
Kane Richardson to Mendis, no run good length outside off, some swing in, pushed to midwicket
Kane Richardson to Mendis, no run plays and misses outside off as he aims to drive on the up, this shaped away
Kane Richardson to Mendis, no run back of a length at off stump, worked to the on side

Kane Richardson to Mendis, SIX runs all the way! That gets the Sri Lanka fans going. Short of a length, Mendis gets inside the line helps it round the corner with almost a front-foot hook over fine leg
Kane Richardson to Mendis, no run good response from Richardson, short of a length outside off, climbs over the top edge
Kane Richardson to Mendis, 1 run back of a length outside off, Mendis stays a touch leg side of it and angles down to third man

Starc to Mendis, 1 leg bye huge shout for lbw as this swings back in and beats Mendis' flick to the leg side...given not out and Finch calls the review. Big question is did this pitch in line? Reasonably full length, nice shape from Starc. Well, well...third umpire says no ball-tracking available. This is interesting. Do Australia
Starc to Perera, FOUR runs angled in the pads, flicked strongly to long leg
Starc to Perera, 1 wide flung down the leg side again, Starc has just lost his line in the last two deliveries
Starc to Perera, no run back on the stumps, Perera gets a little squared up as he defends
Starc to Perera, no run beats him with a full one outside that brings a drive, nice shape away from the left hander
Starc to Perera, 4 leg byes seeing both sides of Starc this over, slips into the pads again and deflects wide of the diving Carey
Starc to Perera, 1 run tapped into the on side
Cummins to Perera, 1 run over the wicket, back of a length, dropped to the off side for a sharp single and Mendis ends up sliding into the stumps. It's chaos out there!
Cummins to Mendis, 1 run short of a length at off stump, takes his bottom hand off the bat and runs it down to third man
Cummins to Perera, 1 run short on leg stump, mistimes his pull and it loops towards square leg
Cummins to Mendis, no run fuller, at off stump, Mendis deep in his crease and drops his bat down on it
Cummins to Mendis, 1 run on off stump, 139kph, stays back to quite a full length, opens the face to third man
Cummins to Perera, SIX runs a big top edge sails over third man, which is the opposite side of the ground he was aiming for when he went for the pull against a short-of-a-length delivery
Kane Richardson to Mendis, 1 run pushed into the covers off the back foot
Kane Richardson to Perera, 1 run a slower ball, full on middle and leg, tucked off the pads to square leg
Kane Richardson to Mendis, no run dropped, but a very tough one! Short, hammers the pull towards Turner at midwicket...off the toe end, and it just reached him

Kane Richardson to Mendis, OUT picks out the man at deep square! Couldn't have found him any better. A short ball from Richardson, Mendis strikes it nicely but straight down McDermott's throat. Mendis is furious. Richardson has his first wicket of the series
Kane Richardson to Fernando, 1 run back of a length outside off, neatly behind the line and punches into the covers...then there's nearly another mix-up in the running!
Kane Richardson to Perera, no run short of a length outside off, played into the covers
Cummins to Fernando, no run back of a length, straight, played to midwicket
Cummins to Fernando, 2 runs that's a nice piece of timing through the covers off the back foot
Cummins to Fernando, no run angled into the pads, short of a length, can't get it past midwicket
Cummins to Fernando, no run at middle and off, keeps it back of a length, defended down the pitch
Cummins to Fernando, 1 run a touch shorter on off stump, plays a swivel-pull to deep midwicket
Cummins to Perera, FOUR runs another top edge! This time over the keeper. You can see the sand burst up as the ball lands, but it still trickles into the rope
Agar to Fernando, 1 run round the wicket, driven to deep cover off the back foot
Agar to Perera, no run round the wicket to the left hander, short on the pads but Perera pulls to the man just behind square
Agar to Perera, 1 run short outside off, cracked to deep cover
Agar to Fernando, 2 runs short again, outside off, better placement this time as he angles it wide of backward point to give the sweeper some work
Agar to Fernando, 1 run angled into the pads, worked through midwicket
Agar to Perera, 1 run gets inside the line and nudges off the pads into midwicket, Agar chases it himself as the Sri Lanka batsmen just walk the single
Zampa to Perera, no run over the wicket, touch short outside off but it's cut straight to backward point
Zampa to Perera, no run brings out the reverse sweep, full at off stump, doesn't connect and it loops to short third man
Zampa to Perera, 1 run full at middle, flicked to deep midwicket
Zampa to Fernando, 1 run touch slower, tossed up very full at off stump, driven to deep cover
Zampa to Perera, 1 run keeps it full, whipped off the toes deep into the leg side but singles won't hurt Australia
Zampa to Fernando, 1 run a bottom-handed flick to the leg side from a full, straight delivery
Agar to Fernando, 1 run full at the stumps, plays forward and gets an inside edge to the leg side...another gentle single
Agar to Perera, 2 runs short of a length, worked off the pads into the leg side and there's better hustle this time to make the second
Agar to Perera, 1 run tucked into midwicket
Agar to Fernando, 1 run angled into the pads, pushed through midwicket to the sweeper
Agar to Perera, 2 runs nicely placed off the back foot as he cuts a slightly short delivery through backward point
Agar to Perera, 1 run on leg stump, turned off the pads to square leg
Zampa to Perera, 1 run nudged through the leg side again, Agar makes good ground to prevent the second
Zampa to Fernando, 1 run full at the stumps, chipped in the air down the on side as the bottom hand takes over
Zampa to Perera, 1 run goes back to a good length ball, square drives to deep cover
Zampa to Fernando, 1 run very full outside off, drives firmly to deep cover
Zampa to Perera, 1 run a googly outside off, driven to deep point
Zampa to Fernando, 1 run comes forward and eases this out to the cover sweeper...just singles milked off that over
Agar to Fernando, 1 run short of a length and just outside off, backs away and cuts to sweeper cover
Agar to Perera, 1 run dropped short at a leg stump line. Pulled out to deep square
Agar to Fernando, no run length and turning away just outside off. Pushed to point off the front foot
Agar to Fernando, 1 run short of a length and in at middle stump, backs away to cut to sweeper
Agar to Perera, 1 leg bye tossed up at a length on leg stump. Steps out and is beaten in flight as he looks to sweep hurriedly. Cops it on the front pad
Agar to Fernando, 2 runs misfield at long-off. Length ball just outside off, slapped on the rise to Smith's left and he over runs it and sticks out a right hand to get something on this
Cummins to Perera, no run short of a length at the stumps, backs away and cuts straight to point
Cummins to Perera, 2 runs slower short ball, slammed in at an off stump line. Creates room by walking into the leg side and looks to pull this. Can only slice to midwicket's left

Cummins to Perera, 1 run top edge falls safely in the square leg region. Bouncer gets steep as he looks to hook and takes his eyes off the ball. Was looking to check that shot or even evade by the time it got up in his face
Cummins to Fernando, 1 run short of a length and rising into the body. Mistimed pull towards deep midwicket
Cummins to Perera, 1 run short and just outside off, pulled into the turf towards deep square

Cummins to Fernando, OUT chipped straight to deep backward square! Short of a length and cramping him up at the hips again. He stays on the front foot and looks to use the angle and pace to launch this behind square. But that's taken well inside
Starc to Perera, 2 runs just clears extra cover. Slower ball at a length outside off. Leans in and jabs with hard hands and has no control of it in the end
Starc to Perera, 1 run length on leg stump, onto his toes as he clips to deep square
Starc to Fernando, 1 run short and in at the ribs. Gets on top of this and drops it behind square with soft hands

Starc to Perera, FOUR runs spanked past extra cover! Starc goes full and Sri Lanka have been starved of that length all series. An attempted slower ball. Ends up right in his slot with a lot of width and powers this to the boundary

Starc to Perera, no run dropped at point! Another full slower ball outside off. Looks to drive and gets a leading edge to point where Kane Richardson is seemingly also deceived by a slower ball - too eager as this floats right into his lap and he has a grab late and puts it down
Starc to Perera, 1 run short in the corridor, looks for the upper cut and just manages to clear the infield in the covers
Zampa to Perera, FOUR runs sliced over third man as he swivels quickly for the reverse sweep. It's short of a length and pushed across him and he was quickly in position
Zampa to Perera, 2 runs that's fifty! He's making use after getting in. This length ball on leg stump is tucked into the midwicket region with soft hands and he's back for the second
Zampa to Perera, 1 run full on leg stump, flicked to long-on with the turn
Zampa to Fernando, 1 run short of a length and sliding into the corridor. Tapped to deep midwicket off the back foot
Zampa to Perera, 1 run full on middle stump, drilled powerfully to long-on's right where Smith picks up and keeps it to one
Zampa to Fernando, FOUR runs outside edge runs away from short third man. Length ball just outside off, looks to drive inside-out and gets a thick edge
Kane Richardson to Perera, 1 run short of a length and just outside off, makes room and swats it down to long-on

Kane Richardson to Fernando, OUT guided straight to the keeper it seems. But he reviews after being given caught behind. Short of a length and climbing up outside off. He looks to run it down to third man as it angles back into him off the pitch. There is a tiny spike as the ball passes outside edge. Sri Lanka will lose the batsman
Kane Richardson to Jayasuriya, no run past the edge. Length ball pushed across the corridor. Hangs the bat out at it and can't make connection

Kane Richardson to Jayasuriya, 1 run short of a length at the hips. Shovels this to deep square's right and McDermott completely fluffs the throw and has Warner ducking for cover at midwicket as it trickles harmlessly towards the middle of the pitch
Kane Richardson to Perera, 3 runs sjhort of a length and spanked on the rise to sweeper's left. Looks like Starc there who runs a long way and flings this back in inches from the boundary to save one
Kane Richardson to Jayasuriya, 1 run length ball just outside off, backs away and looks to scythe it. Comes off the inside half and ends up at mid-off
Agar to Jayasuriya, 1 run length on leg stump, flicked to deep mdiwicket
Agar to Perera, 1 leg bye appeal for lbw as he's caught on the front leg trying to sweep. Agar is around the wicket, that probably pitched outside leg
Agar to Jayasuriya, 1 run length on leg stump, flicked into the leg side on the front foot
Agar to Perera, 1 run length on leg stump, tapped to long-on
Agar to Jayasuriya, no run length on leg stump, flicked to short fine on the front foot
Agar to Jayasuriya, 2 runs length on leg stump, steps out and expertly drops this into the vacant midwicket region with soft hands

Cummins to Perera, OUT taken at extra cover. Finally manages to find that fielder after many close shaves. Short of a length at off. Backs into the leg side and pulls. Slices it right up for the fielder, he barely has to move
Cummins to Jayasuriya, no run length ball slanted across the corridor, left alone
Cummins to Jayasuriya, no run short of a length and jumping up at him as he gets behind the line of this. Defended to point in the end
Cummins to Jayasuriya, 1 run short of a length slower ball just outside off. Steers it to point's right with soft hands
Cummins to Rajapaksa, no run short of a length and just outside off. Defended to point
Cummins to Rajapaksa, no run length and just outside off. Defended to point
Zampa to Jayasuriya, 1 run length on leg stump, nudged to short fine's right with soft hands
Zampa to Rajapaksa, 1 run full on off stump, driven to extra cover where Warner fumbles to allow a run
Zampa to Jayasuriya, 2 runs full on off stump, to the pitch and slams it to long-off's left along the floor. Slides and saves neatly, does Cummins
Zampa to Jayasuriya, 1 run length and just outside off, pushed to midwicket off the back foot

Zampa to Rajapaksa, no run length ball pushed across off stump. Looks to chop that and is beaten. Carey has the bails off meanwhile as the batsman tries to maintain balance on the back foot. The foot rises - Carey waits for it to rise - but is on the floor as he takes the bails off. Not out
Zampa to Rajapaksa, 2 runs length on middle stump, pushed towards long-on with soft hands. His direct hit deflects into the covers where they'll find an extra run
Starc to Jayasuriya, 1 run slower length ball on off stump. Leans in and tucks this behind square with a closed face
Starc to Rajapaksa, SIX runs launched over deep backward square! Overpitched and on the pads. At his pace, the batsman need only get connection on the whip. And he does

Starc to Rajapaksa, FOUR runs using the pace again. Poor lines from Starc. This one is short of a length and into the hips. Once again, he stays inside the line and has a whip at it. To fine leg's left at great speed
Starc to Rajapaksa, 2 runs slower length ball on off stump, opens the face and taps this to sweeper's right. Slides to complete the second
Starc to Rajapaksa, 1 run full and just outside off, mistimed drive along the floor to long-off

Starc to Jayasuriya, OUT loses leg stump. Full ball headed into leg stump, the same kind that was lifted for a six earlier. Jayasuriya though has looked for a reverse ramp, while standing on his feet. No way he's going to pull that off from there
Kane Richardson to Rajapaksa, 1 run full slower ball on off stump, makes some room and clubs this to sweeper cover

Kane Richardson to Malinga, SIX runs smokes it over long-on! Wow! Richardson looks for the slower ball but drops it short. It sits nicely up at off stump and Malinga just lines up beside it and flat-bats it
Kane Richardson to Malinga, 1 run full at the stumps. Makes room and drives to extra cover's right
Kane Richardson to Rajapaksa, 1 leg bye slower short ball into the body. Looks for the slog but cops that on the body
Kane Richardson to Malinga, no run slower length ball following him down leg side. He's behind the line and swinging at this but he can't connect
Kane Richardson to Malinga, 1 run full at middle and leg. Looks to drive and gets a thick inside edge onto boot

8:43pm Sri Lanka finally get to a serviceable score. They lost their openers in the Powerplay and hopes of an acceleration seemed as dim as the last two games. But that partnership for the third wicket allowed some stability, and Kusal Perera got going towards the end of his fifty. A flourish from Rajapaksa and Malinga too at the end. But
Welcome back, folks. Can Sri Lanka push Australia hard in this chase? Malinga will open up...
Malinga to Finch, no run nice start, full at middle, pushed firmly to mid-on
Malinga to Finch, no run back of a length, straight, worked to midwicket
Malinga to Finch, 1 run a slower ball on a good length, tucked into midwicket
Malinga to Warner, no run full at off stump, hint of swing, pushed firmly to the off side
Malinga to Warner, 2 runs touch straighter, allows Warner to work this off the pads backward of square and immediate contrast in the tempo between the wickets
Malinga to Warner, no run finishes with another slower ball at 112, Warner waits and then pushes towards point. Tidy opening over

Lahiru Kumara to Finch, 1 leg bye big appeal first ball! Nips back from a good length, takes Finch on the back leg...a familiar-style of issue for Finch. Caught on the crease with the ball coming back and the review has been called. It has struck him quite high, above the roll on his back leg and he's on his toes. Do we have the t
Lahiru Kumara to Warner, no run full at the stumps, not much footwork from Warner as he drives firmly to mid-off

Lahiru Kumara to Warner, no run what a beauty! At 148kph as well...a ripper from Kumara, back of a length at middle and leg, completely squares up Warner and beats him, clipping the back leg through the keeper who can't take it cleanly. Good job there was no edge
Lahiru Kumara to Warner, FOUR runs bang! Strong response from Warner as he rocks back to a short ball and hammers a pull well in front of square. This is good stuff
Lahiru Kumara to Warner, 1 run fuller, back of a length, on middle and leg at 144kph, Warner taps towards mid-on and scampers
Lahiru Kumara to Finch, SIX runs over mid-on! Full at off stump, Finch swings through the line and sends it handsomely down the ground. In the end the over goes for 11
Malinga to Warner, no run played into the on side
Malinga to Warner, FOUR runs a man in form! Full outside off, Warner goes down on his back knee and flays a cover drive
Malinga to Warner, no run full, 134kph, worked off the stumps to mid-on
Malinga to Warner, no run that's a cracker from Malinga this time, a slower cutter that grips and bounces from back of a length, jumps past the outside edge
Malinga to Warner, no run length ball just outside off, pushed to the covers
Malinga to Warner, 1 run another slower ball, 116kph, shoveled off the stumps wide of mid-on to keep the strike
Pradeep to Warner, 1 leg bye tight single as this bobbles out to the off side...111kph slower ball to start with, takes the pad
Pradeep to Finch, no run back of a length at off stump, defended to cover
Pradeep to Finch, 3 runs back of a length outside off, Finch nicely into position and drives square through the covers. Hauled in just before the rope as three fielders chase it

Pradeep to Warner, 1 run dropped at mid-off! A flying effort from Malinga, who flung himself to his right and had the ball, but it burst out as he hit the ground. Warner driving on the up with immense power. Not sure that was quite as tough as Malinga made out
Pradeep to Finch, 1 run pulls a pretty full delivery, gets a bottom edge towards short fine leg
Pradeep to Warner, 1 run full, a slower ball, punched to mid-on where it isn't stopped cleanly
Lahiru Kumara to Warner, 1 run full at leg stump, slower ball at 104kph, driven towards mid-on who is deep enough for the single
Lahiru Kumara to Finch, no run full and straight, 141kph, can't beat mid-on as he drives
Lahiru Kumara to Finch, FOUR runs full ball outside off, throws his hands through a square drive, places it between cover and backward point
Lahiru Kumara to Finch, 1 run dropped at cover this time! Another shot with power, Finch driving a full delivery, and Oshada Fernando can't hold on to his right
Lahiru Kumara to Warner, 1 run gives himself some room and eases a slower ball into the covers
Lahiru Kumara to Finch, no run a strangled appeal for lbw as Finch aims to work away a straight delivery
Pradeep to Warner, no run moves well outside leg and then drives a low full toss, almost a yorker, straight to cover
Pradeep to Warner, 1 run big appeal lbw as Warner looks to work away a full slower ball, think there was bat involved...yep, big edge
Pradeep to Finch, 1 leg bye another huge appeal for lbw, this time it's Finch missing a swinging yorker but it's sliding down the leg side
Pradeep to Warner, 1 wide short down the leg side, swing and a miss
Pradeep to Warner, 2 runs short of a length, helped backward of square with a pull
Pradeep to Warner, 1 run low full toss outside off, driven into the covers
Pradeep to Finch, no run driven off the back foot to cover
Jayasuriya to Warner, 1 run round the wicket, backs away and cuts square to the off side
Jayasuriya to Finch, SIX runs round the wicket, stand and deliver from Finch as he hoicks this over wide midwicket
Jayasuriya to Finch, 2 runs short on off stump, cut to deep cover
Jayasuriya to Finch, 2 runs very round-arm action, on the pads, worked to square leg
Jayasuriya to Finch, 1 run tucked off the pads to short fine leg
Jayasuriya to Warner, 1 run short and pushed into the pads, not a great ball, but it's just a single as it trickles to short fine leg off a bottom-edged pull/sweep
Sandakan to Warner, 1 run starts with a very short one, Warner rocks back and pulls to deep midwicket
Sandakan to Finch, 1 run full, he uses his feet and drives to long-off
Sandakan to Warner, 1 run touch too short outside off, square drives to deep cover
Sandakan to Finch, 1 run dabs this to short third man, more good running
Sandakan to Warner, 1 run stays in the crease and muscles this to long-on with a short-arm pull
Sandakan to Finch, 1 run steps back and pushes into the covers
Lahiru Kumara to Finch, SIX runs what a stroke! That's a cracker from Finch. A full ball on off stump, it's a perfect lofted off-drive through the line over the rope
Lahiru Kumara to Finch, 1 wide a bouncer angled down the leg side, it's sharp at 143kph but called wide
Lahiru Kumara to Finch, no run 142kph, back of a length, tucked to midwicket
Lahiru Kumara to Finch, 1 run back of a length outside off, driven from the back foot to deep cover
Lahiru Kumara to Warner, 1 wide that's a very short bouncer, left alone and it's another wide
Lahiru Kumara to Warner, 1 run flashed down to third man off the outside edge
Lahiru Kumara to Smith, FOUR runs what a stroke to start with! A short delivery, Smith moves across the crease to get inside the line and whips it off his hip wide of long leg. Brilliant
Sandakan to Warner, 1 run full outside off, Warner's down the pitch and has to reach for it a little but drives safely wide of long-off
Sandakan to Smith, FOUR runs that's delightful! He's been in two balls and played two awesome shots. This is a simple skip down the pitch and a lofted drive straight of long-off
Sandakan to Smith, 2 runs goes back in the crease to a short delivery, worked to deep midwicket
Sandakan to Smith, no run full, wider outside off, driven to cover
Sandakan to Smith, 1 run whipped off the stumps through the leg side
Sandakan to Warner, 1 run swung down the ground to long-off
Pradeep to Warner, 1 run legcutter at a length on leg stump, swiped down to fine leg

Pradeep to Smith, no run full and curving away just outside off. Shuffles and looks to drive, but gets this off the leading edge as the bat face closes. Rajapaksa with a diving stop to his left at extra cover
Pradeep to Smith, no run short of a length at off stump, shapes to pull but that skids onto his thigh and floats up towards point
Pradeep to Smith, 2 runs chipped to long-on's right. Another legcutter, full and up at leg stump. Leans into that one and places it nicely
Pradeep to Warner, 1 wide bouncer dug in too short. Let's that go over middle stump
Pradeep to Warner, no run full on leg stump, looks to flick and misses. Cops it on the front pad
Sandakan to McDermott, no run googly at a length on off stump. Leans in and stabs to extra cover
Sandakan to McDermott, no run just short of extra cover. Length ball pushed across off stump. Looks to drive and doesn't get to the pitch of that. Ends up slicing it
Sandakan to McDermott, 2 runs length on leg stump, gets deep in the crease and pushes to deep midwicket with soft hands
Sandakan to McDermott, 1 run full on leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket
Sandakan to Warner, 1 run short of a length slider wide outside off. Slapped to long-off on the front foot
Sandakan to McDermott, 1 run length outside off, gets forward and drives to long-off
Malinga to McDermott, 1 run full slower ball on leg stump. Allows that to land and tucks it to deep midwicket with soft hands
Malinga to Warner, 2 runs full and just outside off, chips it out to sweeper cover
Malinga to Warner, FOUR runs blazed past point! Short and just outside off, jumps up to get behind that and crunches it aerially past the diving point's left hand
Malinga to Warner, 1 run slower ball on a length at leg stump. Drops it into the square leg region with soft hands

Malinga to McDermott, OUT looks plumb. And given. It did strike him in front of leg though, so they'll have a chat about it...and decided not to review. Full and sliding in at leg stump as he looks to drive. Rapped on the front leg with middle and off visible. Perhaps not plumb like it appeared at first, but just clipping leg stump
Malinga to Turner, no run length and speared in at middle stump. Defended on the front foot
Jayasuriya to Warner, 1 run length on leg stump, jabbed towards mid-on off the front foot
Jayasuriya to Turner, 1 run short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper cover
Jayasuriya to Warner, 1 run length on off stump, opens up and chops to sweeper cover
Jayasuriya to Turner, SIX runs pumps it over deep midwicket! Length ball pushed in fast at middle stump. It's sliding on nicely and he slogs through the line to clear the ropes
Jayasuriya to Turner, 1 run length ball just outside off, driven on the rise to long-off
Jayasuriya to Warner, 1 run full on leg stump, driven down to long-on
Lahiru Kumara to Warner, 2 runs full on middle stump, driven to long-on's left. A tight second run but the throw from there is not ideal

Lahiru Kumara to Warner, no run he's dropped that onto the stumps but the bails have stayed on. The famous zing bails. Short of a length and cramped him with that. It slammed into his mid-riff and the ball dropped down onto the stumps as he swiveled
Lahiru Kumara to Warner, 1 wide short and down leg side, beaten on the pull
Lahiru Kumara to Warner, 1 run legcutter dropped short and down leg side, pulled to fine leg

Lahiru Kumara to Turner, SIX runs steers this over the fine leg boundary. Bouncer rising down leg side. He stays inside the line and shapes to hook, but there's minimal use of the wrists. It's more a ramp by the time he's done
Lahiru Kumara to Turner, 1 run full on middle stump, driven down to long-on
Lahiru Kumara to Warner, SIX runs smoked wide of long-on! Length ball on off stump, sitting nicely up for the slog. He gets the front leg out of the way and slogs nonchalanty
Sandakan to Turner, 2 runs full googly on leg stump. Leans in and clips through midwicket with soft hands
Sandakan to Turner, no run full and very wide outside off. Gets down for the paddle sweep but is beaten
Sandakan to Turner, no run length ball outside off, shuffles and looks to paddle that. Cops it on the pad outside off stump
Sandakan to Turner, 1 run short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper
Sandakan to Warner, 1 run short of a length just outside off, stays leg side and chops it to sweeper to bring up his third consecutive fifty
Sandakan to Turner, 1 run full and wide outside off, driven to long-off
Malinga to Turner, 1 run full on the stumps, tapped down the ground
Malinga to Warner, 1 run slower ball at a length on off stump, dropped into the covers with soft hands
Malinga to Turner, 1 run full on middle stump, driven to long-on
Malinga to Warner, 1 wide bouncer at a middle stump line. Let's that go
Malinga to Warner, 2 runs full outside off, leans in and drives to third man's left
Malinga to Warner, no run slow dipping full toss on off stump. Watchfully tapped to extra cover
Malinga to Warner, 2 leg byes slower ball at a length on leg stump. Looks for the flick and deflects this in front of fine leg off the pad. Calls early for the second
Pradeep to Turner, no run length on off stump, defended on the front foot
Pradeep to Turner, 1 run full and into the pads. Stays tall and clips it down to fine leg
Pradeep to Warner, no run yorker at middle stump, jammed to midwicket
Pradeep to Warner, FOUR runs finished with a boundary! Attempted slower yorker it seems. Ends up as a leg-stump full toss. He holds his balance and caresses this to the long leg boundary

10:30pm Warner finishes unbeaten in the series. And that is another comprehensive win for Australia; the 3-0 scoreline tells it all. Sri Lanka have barely had a moment of dominance all series, and that didn't change tonight. The batting was improved, but not lethal, while it was much the same story with the ball.
David Warner is Man of the Match and Man of the Series.
10:48pm And that is all from us. Thanks for joining.
Australia won by 7 wickets (with 14 balls remaining)
Player of the match is David Warner, AUS
